articles.title: BREAKING NEWS: Concourt rules against IEC, polls to go ahead - IOL
articles.description: The Constitutional Court has ordered the Electoral Commission of South Africa (IEC) to hold local government elections on any day between October 27 and November 1 this year.
articles.content:
The Concourt further instructed the IEC to hold a special voter registration weekend the date of which must be announced within three days of the order which was handed down on Friday.

articles.title: South Africa will no longer send J&J vaccines to Europe, AU envoy says - CNN
articles.description: An arrangement in which Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccines were being shipped from South Africa to Europe has been suspended, African Union (AU) Special Envoy for Covid-19 response, Strive Masiyiwa, has said.

articles.title: Don't use ivermectin to treat Covid-19 - Sahpra says its stance is aligned with the US' FDA - News24
articles.description: The South African Health Products Regulatory Authority has once again warned the public against the use of ivermectin, saying it remains aligned to America's FDA when it comes to the use of the drug.

articles.title: SA superstar Mahlangu claims second gold medal at Tokyo Paralympics - News24
articles.description: South Africa's Ntando Mahlangu claimed his second gold medal of the Tokyo Paralympics on Friday, winning the 200m in the T61 category.
